publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5946 Mr Frank McAveety: Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics—That the Parliament recognises and commends Bank of Scotland for its support of Scottish youth athletes through its sponsorship of scottishathletics and BADMINTONscotland; acknowledges Bank of Scotland’s partnership with the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympics games, which, it considers, shows the bank’s support for the success of Scottish athletes; considers that Bank of Scotland has made generous efforts in aiding Scottish youth athletes in their development right up to elite performer level; furthermore, praises Bank of Scotland’s commitment to increasing athletic participation in Scotland and understands that an estimated 10,000 young people will take part in badminton programmes associated with the sponsorship over the next 12 months, and, finally, congratulates Bank of Scotland on the Bank of Scotland International Championships in Badminton, which many consider to have emerged as the premier tournament on the badminton Europe circuit over the last 10 years.

S3M-5946 Mr Frank McAveety: Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics—That the Parliament recognises and commends Bank of Scotland for its support of Scottish youth athletes through its sponsorship of scottishathletics and BADMINTONscotland; acknowledges Bank of Scotland’s partnership with the London 2012 Olympic and Paralympics games, which, it considers, shows the bank’s support for the success of Scottish athletes; considers that Bank of Scotland has made generous efforts in aiding Scottish youth athletes in their development right up to elite performer level; furthermore, praises Bank of Scotland’s commitment to increasing athletic participation in Scotland and understands that an estimated 10,000 young people will take part in badminton programmes associated with the sponsorship over the next 12 months, and, finally, congratulates Bank of Scotland on the Bank of Scotland International Championships in Badminton, which many consider to have emerged as the premier tournament on the badminton Europe circuit over the last 10 years.

S3M-5946 Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics (lodged on 11 March 2010) David Whitton*, Jackie Baillie*, Mary Mulligan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Mike Pringle*, Karen Whitefield*, Dr Richard Simpson*, James Kelly*, Bill Aitken*
S3M-5946Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics (lodged on 11 March 2010) Paul Martin*, Rhona Brankin*, Hugh Henry*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-5946 Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics (lodged on 11 March 2010) Jack McConnell*
S3M-5946 Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics (lodged on 11 March 2010) Pauline McNeill*
S3M-5946 Bank of Scotland’s Commitment to Scottish Athletics (lodged on 11 March 2010) Marilyn Livingstone*
